content:
QueryableFilterUserControl Class

Definition

Provides a base class for filter controls.

In this Article

public abstract class QueryableFilterUserControl : System.Web.UI.UserControl

Remarks

The QueryableFilterUserControl class is the base class for user controls that render filters that can be plugged into the Dynamic Data filtering framework that is based on the QueryExtender class.

Implementers must override the GetQueryable control, which can return a modified IQueryable object that reflects the filter's state. The base class contains helper methods for building LINQ expression trees.

Constructors

QueryableFilterUserControl()

Initializes a new instance of the QueryableFilterUserControl class.

protected QueryableFilterUserControl ();

Properties

Column

Gets the column to use for filtering.

protected System.Web.DynamicData.MetaColumn Column { get; }
Value
MetaColumn

The column to use for filtering.

DefaultValue

Gets the default values that are mapped for the table.

public string DefaultValue { get; }
Value
String

The default values that are mapped for the table.

Remarks

By default, Dynamic Data provides Boolean, foreign-key, and enumeration filter templates.

DefaultValues

Gets the default values that are mapped for the table.

public System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary<string,object> DefaultValues { get; }
Value
IDictionary<String,Object>

The default values that are mapped for the table.

FilterControl

Gets the data control that handles the filter inside the filter template.

public virtual System.Web.UI.Control FilterControl { get; }
Value
Control

The data control that handles the filter.

Remarks

This property is null if the filter template does not override it.

Methods

Gets the transformed IQueryable object from the source IQueryable object.

public static System.Linq.IQueryable ApplyEqualityFilter (System.Linq.IQueryable source, string propertyName, object value);
source

The source IQueryable object.

propertyName

The name of the property.

value
Object

The value for the propertyName parameter.

Returns
IQueryable

The transformed IQueryable object from the source IQueryable object.

GetQueryable(IQueryable)

Gets the transformed IQueryable object from the source IQueryable object.

public abstract System.Linq.IQueryable GetQueryable (System.Linq.IQueryable source);
source
IQueryable

The source IQueryable object.

Returns
IQueryable

The transformed IQueryable object from the source IQueryable object.

Remarks

You must implement this method if you derive a control from QueryableFilterUserControl.

OnFilterChanged()

Raises the FilterChanged event.

protected void OnFilterChanged ();

Remarks

Call this method when the filter selection has changed in order to notify the data source that the query must be re-run.

PopulateListControl(ListControl)

Populates a list control with all the foreign-key elements or Boolean elements in the table.

public void PopulateListControl (System.Web.UI.WebControls.ListControl listControl);
listControl
ListControl

A list control.

Remarks

Foreign-key columns are populated with elements from the foreign-key table. Boolean columns are populated with "All", "True", and "False".

Events

FilterChanged

Occurs when the stem.Web.DynamicData.QueryableFilterUserControl.OnFilterChanged* method is called.

public event EventHandler FilterChanged;
